questions.explanation:
Norm.

	These shoes had special features like a night reflector, and could make you jump 12% higher. Norm said he was going to try them out. He stretched a little bit and then sat at the bar and drank a beer.

questions.text: Did the "Tonight Show" buy Cliff's submission?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Norm whited out the word "not" in the rejection letter to make it seem as if Cliff's joke was accepted. He wanted to cheer up Cliff.

questions.text: What did Sam get for the bar?
questions.explanation:
Satellite dish.

	Carla found an ad for a dish for $300. The only thing was that Sam would have to install it himself.

questions.text: Who went to see "The Tonight Show"?
questions.explanation:
Norm, Cliff and Ma Clavin.

	Cliff bought some non-refundable tickets to Hollywood, California. He was expecting to hear his joke on the episode they went to.

questions.text: Did the people who went to Hollywood rent a car once they were in California?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	While they are sight seeing you see Cliff driving a car. They went to many places in Hollywood.

questions.text: Who said he was an "avid reader"?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	This is funny since Sam almost never read books. He had read "War and Peace" however. Also, he had read some textbooks to complete to high school requirements to get is diploma. He also read (and consequently) destroyed Diane's first edition copy of "The Sun Also Rises" in the bathtub. Other than that, the only things he read were hair magazines and books he thought were about sex.

questions.text: What network was the "Tonight Show" on?
questions.explanation:
NBC.

	They show the NBC sign right before the three of them go to their seats. NBC stands for National Broadcasting Company.

questions.text: Do they end up using Cliff's joke on the "Tonight Show"?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Norm convinced one of the men who worked for the show to use it in the monologue. Norm told him that Johnny Carson would definitely bomb with this joke.

questions.text: Who confessed to Woody that he often felt lonely?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Woody asked Sam if he thought he should marry Kelly. Sam said that Woody should, and then talked about how he'd probably never find the right woman.

questions.text: What word did Ma Clavin tell Johnny Carson to hit?
questions.explanation:
Have.

	When he told Cliff's joke everyone booed and Cliff told Johnny that he botched his joke. Ma Calvin told him to try it again and put some life into it. They all booed again. Then she told him to hit the word "have" and the audience laughed.
